intro: Lepidagathis goensis, commonly known as the African spurred tortoise plant, is a succulent native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a short, thick stem with opposite, spiny leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the warmer months. Lepidagathis goensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
